value: The Flight Into Egypt: A Night Piece

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein
The Virgin and Child with the Cat and Joseph at the Window

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Description
value: Above a shaped shield, a bearded male half-figure supports on its head a basket of fruit.
Design for Title Page Heading of "The Scarlet Thorn" by John Burroughs

label: Description
value: Above the title, author and Initial letter (I) there is an arrangement of leaves, blossoms, berries and thorn branches labeled "Washington Thorn" (lower left); "White Thorn" (upper left); "Apple Haw" (upper right)

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on off-white illustration board

label: Description
value: Groups of pottery arranged on four shelves, along the top of the page and to the left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and black and brown watercolor, grey gouache, graphite on illustration board

label: Description
value: A young woman is seen walking down a path, turned toward the right. She holds a bird cage, containing a cockatoo, in her left hand.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on illustration board
Embroideries of Mrs. C. W. Holmes, Jr.: Pussy WIllows, Orchard, and Drifting Snow

label: Description
value: Three panels representing embroidery designs. The vertical panel on the left shows pussy willows, and the vertical panel to its right shows drifting snow.  Above, the horitzontal panel shows an orchard.  The two vertical panels are drawn on paper, then mounted to the illustration board; the third, horiztonal panel is drawn directly on the board.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, white gouache, on paper (mounted) and on illustration board

label: Description
value: Brightly painted clown’s head. White ruff at neck. Printed top with red skirt and flowered pants. Lace at knees and wrists. Black hose and shoes.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brightly painted head with black and white bicorn with tri colored cockade. Green uniform. Black hose and shoes. Gold buttons and decorations. Lace at knees and cuffs. Possible a caricature of Admiral Nelson.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brightly painted head with moustache in grey derby hat. White collar, black tie and flowered vest with red buttons. Deep red trousers. Black hose and shoes. Lace at wrists and knees.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Red-faced long-nosed woman dressed in lace-edged cap, apron, coat and plaid dress.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A dark skinned woman with red flannel head-cloth and printed cotton dress with blue fringe at the neck.

label: Description
value: A red-faced, long-nosed man in brown flannel peaked cap, brown coat, blue and brown shirt, plaid trousers and black boots. Lace at the neck.

label: Description
value: Wide-eyed face with red cheeks. Figure dressed in red and white lace, blue fringe at the neck. Remains of crepe hair.

label: Description
value: Sun-nosed head with red cheeks and open mouth. Crepe hair. Printed shirt, blue vest, red trousers, black boots. Blue fringe at ankles and waist. Blue, white and gold scrolled collar.

label: Description
value: Brightly painted head in a tall striped bicorn hat. Black boots. Flowered suite with half white and half striped vest. Rosy cheeks and exposed teeth.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brightly painted head in red-ribboned black bonnet. Mulberry printed dress, white apron, and brightly printed drawers. Black hose and shoes. Lace at neck and knees.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Brightly painted head with white net cap and red ribbon. Printed cotton garment with lace at neck and wrists.

label: Provenance
value: Constance W. Brand; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Lower portion of one of four or more lengths, composing panel set used in repeating fashion in rooms at Royal Pavilion. At bottom, horizontal wave design above which, at right, is half a large flower. Rest of field filled with pairs of dolphins, star fish. Printed in yellow on deep yellow ground.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on handmade paper, varnish

label: Provenance
value: Unused length from Royal Pavilion at Brighton.  Part of a panel set.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Notes
value: Lower portion of one of four or more lengths, composing panel set used in repeating fashion in rooms at Royal Pavilion. At bottom, horizontal wave design above which, at right, is half a large flower. Rest of field filled with pairs of dolphins, star fish. Printed in yellow on deep yellow ground.

label: Description
value: Black parallel bamboo strips on pink ground. Two borders to a width. Shading of strips changes direction approximately half way across each border.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Yellow bamboo shaded with brown. A series of coupled strips connected to one another at right angles by smaller widely spaced bamboo strips. Two complete borders to the width. Excise stamp on back has legend encircling crown: "First Account Taken - 313 (?)"

label: Provenance
value: Unused length from the Royal Pavilion, Brighton.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Simulates wooden Chinese fretwork railing with elements repeating horizontally. An illusion of depth is achieved by means of shadows against yellow irregular wave background. Printed in purple on yellow ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length from the Royal Pavilion.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Parallel strips of brown bamboo, with highlights, on yellow ground. Eight colors. Two borders included in one width. Shadows falling on ground change direction at approximately mid point of each single width of border.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length from the Royal Pavilion.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Two identical borders included in one width of papers. Four colors on light tan ground. Stripes in cream and orange-brown in varying widths and tones.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length from the Royal Pavilion.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Two bamboo trellis borders to the width. Black bamboo on pink ground. Series stops and resumes again at one end.

label: Provenance
value: Unused end from the Royal Pavilion.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Conventionalized brown bamboo strips in high relief against yellow background. The actual ground of the paper is brown. Two borders included in one width.

label: Provenance
value: Unused end from the Royal Pavilion.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Two widths of border included in complete wallpaper width. Bamboo strips in brown, with highlights, closely spaced. Printed on light blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused end from the Royal Pavilion, Brighton.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Repeating paper probably used for a border. Bamboo trellis, diagonal bamboo strips forming squares some of which are crossed with smaller strips of bamboo. Printed on pale blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Used in Duke of York's bedroom, the Royal Pavilion, Brighton.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Description
value: Wide strips of bamboo alternating with two thin strips. Two complete border widths running vertically, beneath which, portion of a third runs horizontally. In each border shading of strips changes direction. Stalks are brownish-cream color. Printed on pale blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length commissioned for the Royal Pavilion at Brighton, England.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Brighton Art Gallery and Museum

label: Notes
value: Wide strips of bamboo alternating with two thin strips. Two complete border widths running vertically, beneath which, portion of a third runs horizontally. In each border shading of strips changes direction. Stalks are brownish-cream color. Printed on pale blue ground.
Design for a Gold and Cabochon Gem Brooch

label: Description
value: Golden brooch in form of pendant. At top, green cabochon-cut gem supports gold chains off of which hang two more green stones, one cabochon-cut, the second, an ovoid shape. Four drop pearls appear through- out the design.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, gum varnish over graphite on tan wove paper

label: Provenance
value: 1950: acquired by Museum (from Pierre Berès, Inc.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Gustav E. Kissel
Design for a Chatelaine with Watch

label: Description
value: Design for a diamond-encrusted golden watch hanging from a heavy golden brooch (chatelaine). Ornamented in neo-Renaissance style with pearls and rubies, this stunning jewel features a golden hour-glass and a figure of Father Time holding a scythe. Winged female sea creatures support the brooch and watch case.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, gum varnish, graphite on buff-colored laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Henri Vever; 1950: acquired by Museum (from Pierre Berès, Inc.)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Gustav E. Kissel

label: Notes
value: Design for a diamond-encrusted golden watch hanging from a heavy golden brooch (chatelaine). Ornamented in neo-Renaissance style with pearls and rubies, this stunning jewel features a golden hour-glass and a figure of Father Time holding a scythe. Winged female sea creatures support the brooch and watch case.

label: Description
value: Blue and white coverlet with a central field of close-set horizontal and vertical repeats of flat, stylized groups of large-scale roses and leaves with rosettes in the interspaces. Bottom border with double-headed eagles alternating with Independence Hall; scattered stars of three-lobed leaves. Inscription at left end: "American Independence Declared July 4, 1776." Borders on both sides with spread eagle alternating with monkeys and double column.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: double cloth

label: Description
value: Square of undyed cotton cloth has a deep border of flat and raised crochet in white and brightly colored cottons. Border has rows of square compartments, some with diamond shapes of raised bumps, others with raised multi-petaled rosettes with glass beads in ceter and deep crocheted lobes. Narrow red and white floral tape insert forms an inner border.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, glass beads Technique: plain weave, crochet

label: Description
value: Four fold screen covered with well-known scenic wallpaper "Venetian Scenes". A market square with obelisk and Italianate buildings in various states of preservation, with figures in uniform and Empire dress. A narrow blue figured border at top and bottom and at the outer edge of extreme right hand panel. Printed in sepia.

label: Physical description
value: Block printed on handmade paper, wood frame

label: Dimensions
value: Overall: 173.4 x 252.1 cm (5 ft. 8 1/4 in. x 8 ft. 3 1/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. John G. Hope

label: Description
value: Long narrow shawl of cream colored cotton embroidered at the ends and along the sides in colored silks and paillettes in a leaf and bow-knot design. Scalloped ends of netting woven from the warp ends. Narrow lace edge with narrow band of paillettes at joins.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Cut paper with floral design with birds mounted on blue paper, on which is an inscription, framed in a carved silver wooden frame. Large curling ribbon at upper center of frame, from which hangs festoons of flowers that cross to the upper corners of the frame. Separate silver label with inscription.

label: Physical description
value: White cut paper mounted on blue paper

label: Provenance
value: Miss Virginia L. Hunt, Washington, DC; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Virginia L. Hunt in memory of Mrs. Ridgley Hunt

label: Description
value: A horizontal rectangle shows two children. The boy has placed a board over a small brook and the girl is in the act of crossing over. A floral rope marks the seperation of the panels which repeat horizontally. Printed in four colors on brown ground.

label: Description
value: Almost complete repeat. Horizontal rectangle, with vase as central motif with winged horses on either side. At extreme right a double tassel with rosette above. Bottom of rectangle has fringe and tassel band. Printed in brown, green on dark, light gray ground.
